title: Stacey Solomon laughs off her fake tan fail as she poses for cute family photo

Stacey Solomon laughed off her fake tan fail as she shared an adorable family photo.

The Loose Women star went to dramatic lengths to get her boyfriend and sons into cute matching outfits.

The 30-year-old said she'd had to trick beau Joe Swash, 37, and sons Zachary, 11, and Leighton, seven, into co-ordinating their clothes.

Stacey popped on a cosy beige jumper dress and dressed baby Rex, five months, in a brown onesie and beige hat as she gathered her troop together for the cute autumnal picture outside their Essex home.

Joe is wearing a camel coat on top of his black T-shirt and jeans, while Zachary and Leighton, Stacey's children from previous relationships, wore matching brown jackets too.

(Image: Instagram)

Stacey said on Instagram : "Autumn walks My absolute world in one picture

"Off out for a walk to wear the pickles out as much as possible before tonight. So excited to take them on an adventure later

"I hope you’ve all had a lovely weekend and a very happy Sunday. Love you all

"P.S I definitely should have gone easier on the tan

"P.P.S I purposely picked out their clothes today (including Joes) so they’d match but have no idea until we all stood together"

"Life goals," Chanelle Hayes commented.

While one fan told Stacey: "You look beautiful"

Another said: "Gorgeous family photo"

And one dubbed the snap a "Perfect family photo".

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX)

Stacey's picture captures the time of year perfectly, with her family posing up surrounded by orange flowers, browning leaves and stacks of pumpkins.

Fans have recently become convinced that Stacey and Joe are about to get engaged, and she's said she'd still like him to propose even though they might never get married.

She told new magazine: "I want an engagement ring, but I'm not bothered about getting married.

"Neither of us are! I have those weird preset ideas that I should get married and have a big white dress but it's not the be all and end all. We have our family, we're together, we're practically married in our opinion.

"That piece of paper for us isn't something we feel we need right now."
